reporter_caption.center: KING v. SCHOOL COMMITTEE OF WORCESTER, 374 Mass. 829 (1978)

caption.center: SANDRA JEAN KING another vs. SCHOOL COMMITTEE OF WORCESTER another.

opinion.opinion_text: The case is remanded to the Superior Court. The judgment previously entered in that court, dismissing the action as to some defendants, is to be vacated. Trial of the case, if any party so moves, shall be continued at least until definitive legislation as to governmental immunity is enacted, or until the January, 1978, legislative session ends without the enactment of such legislation. So ordered.
